intro: Trichera dipsacifolia subsp. gracilis, commonly known as slender false nettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clustered inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
